CHAT.comment: Chi and Mot sit on the floor and Mot moves closer as Chi begins to read. The first one and a half sentences are not recorded. Chi reads laboriously and points to words , often taking a few or several seconds before decoding and reading aloud words. He seems to concentrate hard and remains determined to tackle each problematic word. Mot lets Chi read independently , yet attends carefully to him and seems proud of his efforts. When Chi runs into a difficult word , she usually lets him struggle with it for several seconds before providing it. Her tone of voice is always supportive. Once Chi is given a word (eg through , cocoon) he tends to retain it , as evidenced by his easy access and use of it later on in the book reading

u.a: probably not decoding each word for this phrase anymore
MOT smiles when Chi reads salami
points to slice so that Mot will help
